isis.stitle: 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS SPICER AUTOMATE-2 - TROUBLESHOOTING (ELECTRICAL) - CONFIRMING PROPER OPERATION OF CONTROLLER TO TRANSMISSION WIRING HARNESS AND NEUTRAL SHIFT SOLENOID

svcproc.title: CONFIRMING PROPER OPERATION OF CONTROLLER TO TRANSMISSION WIRING HARNESS AND NEUTRAL SHIFT SOLENOID

step1.para: Disconnect the 19 pin connector of the Transmission to Controller Wiring Harness from the Transmission Controller.
Connect an ohm meter across pins 5 and 16 (International, pins 5 and 14) of the transmission Wiring Harness.
If the reading is greater than 8 ohms but less than 20, the neutral shift circuit is functioning properly. Go to the next step listed in the Problem-List (page 96 or 97).

para.emph: If the reading is not between 8 ohms and 20 ohms:

step2.para: Disconnect the "N" shift valve on the opposite end of the Wiring Harness. This connector is located near the piston housing on the right of the transmission and is connected to the Neutral Shift Solenoid. The solenoid is marked "N" on the actuator housing near the base of the solenoid and is the middle solenoid.
With the ohm meter still across pins 5 and 16 (International, pins 5 and 14), the meter should read greater than 100,000 ohms.
If the meter reading is less than 100,000 ohms, replace the Wiring Harness. This should correct the fault.

If the meter reading is greater than 100,000 ohms, short the two pins on the neutral connector and again read the resistance between pins 5 and 16 (International, pins 5 and 14). Resistance should read less than 5 ohms.
If resistance is greater than 5 ohms, replace the Wiring Harness. This should correct the fault.

If resistance is less than 5 ohms, the Wiring Harness is functioning properly. Check the resistance of the solenoid coil by attaching an ohm meter on two solenoid pins. Resistance in the coil of the Neutral Shift Solenoid should read between 8 ohms and 20 ohms. If it does not, replace the solenoid by following the instructions to remove or replace See Procedure .
